I'm not sure if I want to buy or leasing. Can you tell me the differences?

Sure! When you buy a vehicle, you own it outright and are free to modify or sell it as you choose. However, buying a vehicle can be more expensive upfront, and you may have to take out a loan which will accrue interest.

Leasing a vehicle, on the other hand, allows you to drive a new vehicle for a set period of time, usually 2-3 years, while paying a lower monthly payment. However, you don't own the vehicle at the end of the lease, and there may be fees and restrictions on how many miles you can drive.
